instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3476 boot problem
threads.message:
Arrived with no liquid damage, there was just flux around the SMC . When turned on board draws around 200 mah and fan spins fast.

Changed SMC from donar to rule out. At first was booting normally around 600 mah and normal spinning fan.

After reassembling in case same issue returned. Removed again from case with nothing connected but DC IN board but same issue persist.

Any ideas on this one? Could something in the case be killing the SMC?

threads.title: 820-3476 boot problem
threads.message: Fan spins at max, if no trackpad connected...

threads.title: 820-3476 boot problem
threads.message:
Not booting properly. Stuck at 0.125 ma with fast fan spin. Same happens with known good trackpad.

Properly booting board is around 0.600 ma

threads.title: 820-3476 boot problem
threads.message:
Something in the board reacted to the heat; probably PCH/CPU.
Heat and check if board boots again.

threads.title: 820-3476 boot problem
threads.message: still not booting properly after heating PCH/CPU
